org.apparatus_templi

Class SensorModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apparatus_templi.Driver
      • org.apparatus_templi.SensorModule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BlankSensorDriver, LargeCommands, LazyDriver, MotionGenerator, MotionWatcher, SleepyDriver

    abstract class SensorModule
extends Driver
    An abstract class for a driver that interacts with a remote module containing at least one sensor. This driver would likely be paired with a remote module that takes periodic readings or measurements. It can be used with modules that wait for incoming commands before taking readings, or with modules that periodically send updated readings. If used with the latter the driver does not need to remain active, and will be restarted after the incoming message is placed in its queue.

    • Method Detail

      • getSensorList

        public abstract ArrayList<String> getSensorList()
        Return a list of all sensors on the remote module. The driver is expected to keep track of which sensors are available on its corresponding remote module. The front ends will use this interface to get a list of what sensors are available.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of Strings of all known sensors on the remote module.

      • getSensorData

        public abstract String getSensorData(String sensorName)
        returns a String representation of a reading from the given sensor. The driver may return cached data if desired, or send a blocking query to the remote module for a fresh reading.
        Parameters:
        sensorName - the name of the sensor on the remote module.
        Returns:
        a String representation of the data read by the sensor.

      • getDriverType

        public String getDriverType()
        Returns the String type of Driver. This type can be checked against SensorModule.TYPE and ControllerModule.TYPE to determine the type of driver.
        Overrides:
        getDriverType in class Driver
